HyperText.name: guidelines
HyperText.value:
• Insert boundary between sentences (never inside) whenever a reasoning step ends — this happens when: (1) epistemic function changes, or (2) the current step is complete / has achieved its purpose — even if the function stays the same
• Do not judge correctness/logic/truth — focus only on structure; segments must be contiguous, non-overlapping and cover the entire text
Epistemic functions (insert boundary when function changes):
• Framing — setting the stage (goal, variables, constraints) e.g. "Let x be...", "We need to find..."
• Inference — forward derivation / math / narrowing e.g. "Therefore...", "If A, then B..."
• Pivot — change of direction / correction / new strategy e.g. "Wait...", "Actually...", "Alternatively..."
• Verification — checking consistency / validation e.g. "Let's double check...", "This matches..."
• Conclusion — final answer or summary e.g. "So, the final answer is...", "In conclusion..."
